attributes.action: Increase Maritime patrols / air surveillance at sea to protect the UK
attributes.background: Not enough patrol boats or air surveillance re intelligence and prevent terriosts traveling across the English Channel to gain entry into the UK.   Only five patrol boats currently. I reference 15/04/16 two Iranian men called 999 whilst floating in a small rubber boat in the sea

attributes.action: All new trees planted on Government owned land should be fruit trees
attributes.background: All new trees on Government owned land should be fruit trees and the produce of those trees should be made freely available to members of the public

attributes.action: Call on the government to publicly confirm support for strong encryption.
attributes.background: The government should not erode the security of our devices or applications, pressure companies to keep and allow government access to our data, mandate implementation of vulnerabilities or backdoors into products or have disproportionate access to the keys to  our private data.
attributes.additional_details:
The public demands privacy, security, and integrity for their communications and devices. As a public, we should be confident that the services we use havenâ€™t been weakened or compromised by government mandate or pressure. No legislation or private agreement with the government should undermine our rights.

Weakening encryption weakens the entire Internet. Endorse strong encryption and encourage other world governments to do the same.

attributes.action: Stop the reassessment and resultant refusal of blue badges to disabled people
attributes.background:
A GOVERNMENT SHOULD BE JUDGED UPON HOW IT TREATS ITS LEAST FORTUNATE CITIZENS 
We are in a period of time where disabled people all across the country are being re-assessed for their needs, including their access to a blue badge. Please put a stop to the 1000s of disabled people losing them unjust.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this reassessment traumatic enough for disabled people, with the potential consequence of losing their ability to confidently leave the house, assessors are in a position where they have to justify their performance through means of denying access to a certain number of people, thus looking to deny future access to a blue badge wherever they see fit. Recently, a family member who cannot walk 50 feet was told her blue badge is being revoked, due to 'evidence' that they can walk fine.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Create mandatory recycling waste legislation in England
attributes.background: In Scotland - the regulations brought in, in January 2014, require all businesses and organisations to separate key materials â€“ plastic, glass, metals, paper and card â€“ for recycling, while most food businesses are also required to separate food waste for collection.
attributes.additional_details:
- See more at: http://www.zerowastescotland.org.uk/content/meeting-regulations-legislation#sthash.tem8wOF6.dpuf

The government needs to catch up with other, more forward thinking and environmentally aware countries to legislate on waste recycling as a matter or extreme urgency, to prevent the needless, toxic pollution of our earth, on which, all humans depend for their existence!

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Ban cyclists using mobile phones whilst actively riding.
attributes.background: It has become evident, that there is an increasing number of cyclists on UK roads, pavements and cycle ways, utilising their mobile phones whilst actively riding. Not only are they putting themselves and pedestrians at risk, but the driver of road vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: If there were to be an accident involving a car and cyclist, the motorist would face consequences due to damage caused. There is an increasing call for drivers to be safer when it comes to cyclists, and the way in which they use the road (eg passing with enough space) but how do we guard against unsafe cyclists on their mobile devices, taking a call and/or sending a message. It is unsafe for a motorist and therefore unsafe for a cyclist.

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than Â£60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Stop UK Police from allowing officers to wear a burka
attributes.background: http://www.expressandstar.com/news/2016/09/09/west-midlands-police-officers-may-wear-burkas/

attributes.action: Make adult adoption legal in the UK
attributes.background: Many people today do not live in traditional nuclear families; and many children form a stronger bond with a step-parent or relationship with someone of a similar nature as opposed to a biological parent.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems, for many reasons, children and their potential adopters don't get the opportunity to discuss and/or execute adoption until the child has reached legal adulthood; and by this point the UK government no longer views the said child as eligible for adoption.
The implications of this are social and legal issues that arise later in life surrounding the relationship between child and, for example, step-parent.
I believe the 2002 UK Adoption and Children Act is outdated for modern day Britain.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Increase funds and awareness of homeless shelters for young people on our street
attributes.background: Homeless Youth are far too often stereotyped as dangerous troublemakers. Change is needed, as homeless youth need to be noticed. We need to provide food, water and shelter. We need your help to raise awareness, and end homelessness in Youth for good. Help our cause. #itcouldbeme.
attributes.additional_details:
We are part of the Jackman Team, National Citizen Service (NCS) The Challenge, Wave 11, Croydon. Over the past week we have planned a campaign to help homeless Youth in our area on Friday 26th August 2016 in Croydon town centre.
Abuse, money loss, family bereavement are all causes of our new generation becoming homeless. Do we really want the future to be on our streets? Help our cause. Sign our petition. Together, we can end Youth homelessness for good.

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Return the railways to full state control and ownership
attributes.background:
High prices, rotten service on our trains..Let get our railways back to full state ownership so profits benefit train users not shareholders..
Each private contract ends so it can be taken over by the state. No big buyouts needed..

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Reduce APD to bring it in line with other European countries.
attributes.background: For too long the UK has paid extortionate taxes on air travel - far higher than other countries. Reduce APD so that people can afford their well earned holidays.

attributes.action: Declare a national day of mourning when David Attenborough dies.
attributes.background: All non-essential services stop (most offices, shops etc) in order for all to stay home and watch his programmes.

attributes.action: Make inheritance tax applicable to all estates without exception.
attributes.background: It appears very rich people can avoid paying inheritance tax by using tax avoidance measures such as trusts. It would be fair if tax laws were simple and applied to everyone. If it is the law that inheritance tax is paid on estates above a certain value it must apply to everyone without exception.

attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: Register Endometriosis As a Disability
attributes.background: Hello My name is Selina-Louise and I Suffer With a Condition Called Endometriosis its a life changing condition which is extremely painful , it's where the lining of the uterus grows outside and can spread to the bowls and even lungs there is no cure.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a known condition and defiantly should be registered as a disability it's incredibly painful and has left some women infertile

attributes.action: Make discrimination of tattoos/piercings in the workplace a criminal offence
attributes.background: People shouldn't be discriminated against for their tattoos or piercings because it doesn't affect your quality/quantity of work. It's the same as discriminating against someone for their hair/eye/skin colour.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are discriminated against for their tattoos/piercings and a lot of people are rejected jobs because of them. body art doesn't affect the way someone works or how much someone works. so why are tattoos and piercings such a problem in the workplace?

attributes.action: Debit card charges to be set at a fair level and charges itemised on  reciept .
attributes.background:
Shop can currently charge what ever they like if a card is used .
goverment should set a max fee and ensure the fee charged is itemised on reciept

attributes.action: Government to take full admittance on the 'tainted blood scandal' & an apology.
attributes.background: The "Tainted Blood Scandal" is the event of nearly 5,000 people being infected with the Hepatitis C and 1,200 being infected with HIV, often during treatment for Haemophilia or Blood Transfusion by the NHS in the 1970s and 1980s and the subsequent government reaction.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite numerous calls from campaigners, victims and MP's over the years, successive governments in Westminster have refused to hold a Public Inquiry into the matter.

To date no government, health or pharmaceutical entity in the UK has admitted liability for the scandal and no compensation has been paid to those infected or affected. Compensation has been paid in Ireland.

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Negotiate personal EU membership for certain categories of UK citizen.
attributes.background: Citizens with either: 1. A spouse with EU citizenship; or 2. Pension rights in an EU member state; have had their European homeland taken from them and their family lives crippled. Personal EU membership confirmed by an official passport endorsement would help to mitigate that injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
Under Personal Membership of the EU, eligible individuals would benefit from Non-discrimination and Citizenship of the Union as described in Part Two of the Consolidated Treaties and Charter of Fundamental Rights, Articles 18â€“25.
http://europa.eu/pol/pdf/consolidated-treaties_en.pdf#page=57

attributes.action: Pass legislation to restrict betting on referenda and general elections.
attributes.background: Shortly before the EU Referendum, bookmakers' odds for Remain were 1/4, while those for Leave were 5/1. Such odds have the potential to influence voting, irrespective of the political issues at stake. It is reported that 69 per cent of individual bets were placed on Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference: Financial Times dated 26 June 2016
"Brexit wagers set new record for non-sports bets" by Paul McClean.

attributes.action: A public enquiry to review why people voted as they did in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
It too easy for politicians just to say referendum complete, democracy has been served. Public opinion must be present throughout the whole process, to ensure we receive a democratic outcome. 

This is a massive decision in the country's history we should find out the facts before we progress.
attributes.additional_details:
UK decision makers must be armed with infomation which details the reasons why the UK electorate voted as they did. Enabling these decision makers to formulate the next steps in a way which is in line with public opinion.

Lies have been told on both sides.

People seem to have been unaware of possible economic consequences.

Decisions have been revaluated.

Votes may have been cast as a protest against the UK government.

attributes.action: Rejecting Brexit - find a better alternative to leaving the EU.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to refrain from invoking Article 50. Instead we call upon you to work with the other 27 EU members to find a solution to the issues associated with the free movement of people throughout the EU and, if necessary, to subsequently hold a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A key issue for many who voted to leave the EU is unlimited migration of EU citizens into the UK. The issue of migration within the EU impacts countries beyond the UK and must be addressed by the EU as a whole to prevent further countries voting to leave.

If the UK were to leave the EU around half the UK population would still be left dissatisfied. By contrast, we believe that the UK remaining in a reformed EU could satisfy a significantly larger majority of the UK population.

attributes.action: Make the Chilcot Enquiry free to the public instead of costing Â£767
attributes.background: Taxpayers money funded the work of the Chilcot enquiry so why are we now being charged Â£767 for the findings?  It should be free.  The average wage in the UK is Â£26,500 which means that an average person would have to spend 43% of their monthly post-tax income to get access.  This is wrong.

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: All companies relocating to the EU to pay all tax owing to the exchequer.
attributes.background: Vodafone may quit the UK as a result of the Brexit refrendum. HMRC did a deal with them recently. If any company relocates to within the EU, HMRC must annul any deals made, audit them properly and they must pay all tax owing from the last ten years plus interest immediately.

attributes.action: Make Friday a Half working day
attributes.background: Gives everyone a longer weekend. People will be happier and less stressed.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties

attributes.action: Referendum on income tax
attributes.background:
Holding a referendum has proven to be an effective and democratic way to decide the nation's future in matters of highest importance.
We therefore propose to hold a referendum to decide to abolish the income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the tax payers have paid a weekly amount of Â£3.1billion in
income tax across all bands. We propose to abolish such mandatory
payment to the state, and instead to take back control of this money
and fund the NHS with an additional Â£3.1billion per week.
In order to comply with the rules of democracy we suggest that no less than the majority (i.e. 23,299,988 people) of eligible voters must be in favour. We can entrust the voters to make the right decision for
the Country.

attributes.action: Investigate UK areas of deep social dislocation and propose remedial measures
attributes.background: The result of the EU Referendum on 23 June revealed significant differences between different parts of the UK. Polls also revealed sharply constrasting social circumstances and motivations for the different votes. There appears to be a causative correlation between vote and social circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
The poll conducted by Lord Ashcroft shows significant social, educational and age differences between the two sides of the EU Referendum votes: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/
The differences in the voting in different parts of the country are readily available.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: Don't scrap the right to buy on uk council homes
attributes.background:
Don't  scrap  the right to buy scheme for uk council homes 


The right to buy  is the only way most people will ever get on the housing ladder
